business.headline: Booking plans job cuts as part of company's reorganisation planBooking Holdings, which owns brands like Booking.com and Kayak, did not disclose how many jobs would be affected but said it expected to provide more details on timing, likely impact on employees and financials "in due course".

Elon Musk's Tesla hits $1 trillion market value after Trump winThe electric automaker's shares jumped 8.2 per cent to $321.22, catapulting the company's valuation above the trillion-dollar mark for the first time in more than two years.

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Watch: Trailblazers awarded at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024Business Today unveiled the 21st edition of its Most Powerful Women in Business list on Friday, celebrating 60 exceptional women leaders who are pioneering change, driving growth, and inspiring progress across diverse industries. This year's edition brings in 12 fresh faces and recognises four returning achievers, underscoring the dynamic nature of leadership in business. Watch the award ceremony here on India Today.

I salute the trailblazers: Kalli Purie at Business Today's Most Powerful Women eventKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, lauded the growing accomplishments and transformation of women leaders in India.

Trailblazers on Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 listThis year's Business Today Most Powerful Women list introduces 12 new faces, four returning achievers, and 37 repeat honourees from last year. Two trailblazers entered the MPW Hall of Fame after seven-time wins.

Americans can learn a lesson or two from India: Piyush Goyal on women representationUnion Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal lauded India's approach to women's empowerment and said that Americans can learn a lesson or two from India on women representation.

Harley-Davidson tariffs to be cut after Trump's return? Piyush Goyal respondsSpeaking at the Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Piyush Goyal expressed India's openness to reconsidering the tariffs on the iconic motorcycles.

Women leaders share insights on achieving work-life balance and success at BT MPW 2024At the Business Today MPW 2024 session, Ritu Arora, CEO & CIO of Allianz Investment Management, Asia Pacific, Nirupa Shankar, Joint MD of Brigade Group; and Devita Saraf, Chairperson & CEO of Vu Group, shared insights on striking a fine balance between work, life, health and wealth.

Women need to move from being savers to investors: Radhika GuptaSpeaking at the Business Today Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Radhika Gupta, MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, emphasised the need for women to move beyond saving and start investing.

It's not complicated: Radhika Gupta urges women to manage their own moneySpeaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Edelweiss Mutual Fund Managing Director and CEO Radhika Gupta said that while women have been the "chief financial officers" of their households for generations, it's time to extend that role into the financial markets.

Women have always had a tough time breaking barriers in business: Padmaja Ruparel at BT MPW 2024Speaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Padmaja Ruparel said women always had a tough time breaking barriers in business.

Zomato, Swiggy accused of unfair practices in food delivery market: ReportThe investigation found these companies implemented practices that gave preferential treatment to certain restaurants on their platforms.
Sensex, Nifty end in red as FII selling offsets IT gains; RVNL tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 55.47 points to settle at 79,486.32, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 89.95 points to 24,109.40.

Shiv Nadar, billionaire with a big heart, donates Rs 2,153 crore in FY24For the third time in five years, Shiv Nadar and his family have topped the EdelGive-Hurun India Philanthropy List 2024, contributing Rs 2,153 crore in the fiscal year 2024.

Sharan Hegde of 1% Club faces criticism after laying off 15% employeesPopular finfluencer Sharan Hegde is facing backlash after announcing layoffs at his company, 1% Club. His LinkedIn post has drawn criticism from many on social media.

Indian Hotels share price jumps over 6% to hit 1-year high. Buy, hold or sell?Indian Hotels share price: After a softer June quarter, the Tata group's hospitality arm showed strong recovery, buoyed by wedding-driven demand in Mumbai and pent-up bookings delayed by Q1's election and weather impacts.

Reliance Power share price hits 5% lower circuit after major setback. Details hereReliance Power shares have faced significant volatility this year. The stock has surged by 103% over the past year, reaching a 52-week high of Rs 54.25 in early October.

Trent share price continues to fall. Should you buy, sell or hold? At 11:24 am, Trent's share price was down 2.69% to Rs 6,323.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In the previous session, Trent shares fell 8%.

Explained: Why Ircon International share price slipped 5% after Q2 resultsFor the July-September quarter, Ircon reported a standalone net profit of Rs 202.22 crore, down 12.2% year-on-year (YoY). Revenue from operations also saw a steep fall, dropping 20.3% YoY to Rs 2,298.86 crore.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Maharashtra unsafe when PM visits: Sanjay Raut on 'ek hai to safe hai' callShiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's "Ek hai toh safe hai" (We are safe if we are united) slogan, asserting that Maharashtra is already a safe state.

CCTV captures moment massive blast ripped through Pak railway station, 25 killedThe blast took place inside the railway station when the Peshawar-bound express was about to leave for its destination, a senior police official said.

BJP's Yediyurappa, ex-Minister to face prosecution over misuse of Covid fundsThe recommendation stems from allegations regarding irregularities in the 2020 procurement of three lakh PPE kits from Chinese companies during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Pak PM congratulates Trump, gets community noted for using X that he bannedPakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif congratulated Donald Trump using X, faced criticism for using the platform after banning it.

Won't have sex, US women vow as part of 4B revenge against men for Trump winA large number of women in the US are blaming men for Donald Trump's victory, and joining the 4B movement in protest. The 4B movement, which has its origins in South Korea, is about women vowing no sex, no relationships, no marriage and no childbirth.

Tortured by Army officer, wanted to become a militant: New J&K MLA's revelationNational Conference MLA Qaiser Jamshaid Lone said that during his younger years, he wanted to become a militant after he was "tortured and humiliated" by an Army officer during a military crackdown.

Ex-Himachal Chief Minister hosts samosa party to mock Sukhvinder SukhuFormer Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur organised a samosa party with BJP workers to mock the Congress over a controversy over a 'CID probe into missing samosas' intended for Sukhvinder Sukhu.
Couldn't save samosas, yeh kya samvidhan bachayenge?Can the lords and saviours of the nation protect the Constitution if these saviours can't even save our savouries?

Hum Saath Saath Hain turns 25: Can new-age stars recreate 90s family magic?Sooraj Barjatya's film Hum Saath Saath Hain, which remains popular for its portrayal of love, unity, and family values, completed 25 years. On the occasion, the actors of the 1999 film discussed the possibility of witnessing a sequel, capturing its timeless appeal, despite shifting industry trends.

Making daughter-in-law sleep on carpet, prohibiting TV not cruelty: High CourtIn its ruling, the court acquitted the man, his parents, and his brother, who had been convicted by a lower court for cruelty towards his late wife.

Video: Gujarati family holds 'funeral' for 12-year-old car, over 1,500 attendees joinA family in Gujarat bid farewell to their beloved 12-year-old car with a full-fledged burial ceremony. Several videos of the event went viral on social media.

Annoyed by noise, two women burn five puppies alive in UP's Meerut, case lodgedIn Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, two women allegedly burned five stray puppies alive due to noise frustration. Police have filed a case against the two accused.

Video: Tanker hits father, son sitting outside shop in Faridabad; driver fleesTwo people were injured after a man hit them with a sewer tanker vehicle he was driving at Nagla Ghazipur Road in Faridabad.

Uddhav mocks PM Modi, Amit Shah for taking Bal Thackeray's name for votesUBT Sena Chief Uddhav Thackeray pointed to the visual presence of Balasaheb Thackeray, his father and Shiv Sena founder, on campaign posters.

Is the new trend electrolysis better for hair removal than laser?Electrolysis is a hair removal technique that permanently removes unwanted hair by targeting each hair follicle individually.

Ajay Devgn, Rohit Shetty to begin work on Golmaal 5 soonBollywood star Ajay Devgn and director Rohit Shetty will soon begin work on their highly anticipated project, Golmaal 5. The casting details are yet to be announced.

BTS video shows how Trump comes up with his social media postsThe video shows Donald Trump composing his social media posts in real time while hearing a speech of Kamala Harris as his aide types it out at breakneck speed.

Indians stuffed in train toilets, China moves billions with little fussMillions of travellers get added in India during the festive season, putting pressure on the railway network. But how has China managed its lunar holiday travellers, which is much higher than India's? This is the bigger story behind people stuffed in train toilets in India.

Elon Musk joins Trump's call with Zelenskyy amid White House role buzz: ReportElon Musk was with Trump during the 25-minute call with Zelenskyy. During the conversation, Zelenskyy congratulated Trump for his decisive victory in the US presidential elections this week.

John Wick action director JJ Perry teams up with Yash for ToxicHollywood action director JJ Perry collaborated with Yash for his upcoming gangster drama, Toxic. Directed by Geetu Mohandas, the film promises thrilling action sequences.

sports.headline: Sanju Samson's wife reacts to hundred vs Proteas: My forever favourite heroSanju Samson's wife Charulatha reacted to her husband's scintillating hundred vs South Africa in Durban. Are India being fair to Rinku Singh? Aakash Chopra questions batter's spotAakash Chopra has questioned the Indian team management's decision to always send Rinku Singh down the order at No.6. The southpaw hasn't got a lot of chances to perform in recent times with the bat.

Would have continued playing till 50: James Anderson on his retirementJames Anderson opened up about his retirement and said that he would have continued playing till 50. He recently expressed his interest in playing IPL as he registered his name in the mega auction.

Marseille coach Roberto De Zerbi threatens to quit as home woes continueRoberto De Zerbi declared he was "ready to leave" Olympique de Marseille after his team suffered a 3-1 home defeat to AJ Auxerre on Friday night. De Zerbi's side had won only one of their five home games, leaving the Italian coach frustrated and questioning his future with the club.

Sanju Samson 2.0: India batter reveals roles of Gambhir, Suryakumar in revivalSanju Samson has revealed the roles played by Gautam Gambhir and Suryakumar Yadav in his revival as a T20I batter. Samson scored his second consecutive T20I hundred in the first match of the series against South Africa.

AUS A vs IND A: Dhruv Jurel hits 2nd gritty fifty, puts hand up for Perth TestDhruv Jurel made a strong case to be part of the upcoming Perth Test as he scored a second consecutive fifty in the unofficial Test against Australia-A on Saturday, November 9. Jurel once again came to India-A's rescue in Melbourne.

FIH Awards: Harmanpreet Singh wins Player Of The Year, Sreejesh best goalkeeperIndia's Harmanpreet Singh was adjudged as the FIH Player Of The Year, while PR Sreejeshn took home the Goalkeeper Of The Year award in the men's category on November 8, Friday. Both men played a crucial role in India's bronze medal win at Paris Olympics.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
